alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Effingham; Liberty; Long; McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 7:07AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Chatham, Effingham, Liberty, Long and McIntosh. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hinesville, Pooler, Richmond Hill, Tybee Island, Darien, Ludowici, Fort Stewart, Coffee Bluff, Tibet, Windsor Forest, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Savannah International Airport, Godley Station, Hutchinson Island, Wilmington Island, Jones and McIntosh.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
